column5: Hmmmmm...........haven't needed that fix for my 1990 GMC Sierra, must be a Ford thing, hee hee hee.     Oooohhhhh................buuurrrnnnnn............  :whistling:
Are those pics from Gilligan's Island.....

I have a bunch of friends that guide in Alaska and that is the reason they never leave the plane unatended. One friend had to stay with the plane once and was catching a few winks when he awaoke to the plane bouncing up and down. He looked out of the window to see a large black bear bouncing on one of the planes pontoons. A bear banger shot out of the window fixed the problem.
Happens here in the North of Ontario too. I know a guy that had his boat seats ripped apart by a bear. Thanks goodness our provincial government is doing their best to control the bear populations.
We don't use plastic gas cans in the boats at our fly out destinations 'cause the bears punch them full of holes.
KILL THE BEARS, SAVE THE SEATS!!! Jim
Here in Springfield we pay a bear tax.  No bear problems here.

I flew into a outpost in Gogama that would have been better if the cabin was made out of duct tape.....as a matter of fact the outhouse only had 3 walls and no door....even the bears wouldn't come around to this site...they knew better.

Here's the story as I received it.    During a private "fly-in" fishing excursion in the Alaskan wilderness, the chartered pilot and fishermen left a cooler and bait in the plane. And a bear smelled it.. This is what he did to the plane.            The pilot used his radio and had another pilot bring him 2 new tires, 3 cases of duct tape, and a supply of sheet plastic. He patched the plane together, and FLEW IT HOME!       I heard that the pilots name was Wayne. Some dude from Ontario.
how much duck tape they carry with them ?!?  woops didnt see part with other pilot
That's impressive !
Somehow I don't think an AME would sign off on that....
Why not... it would pass a maule fabric punch test! lol   Ya bring'm home anyway you can...
Red Green would be proud!
Thats awesome!!  LOL..  just like new....
beautiful!  I still prefer Gorilla tape...but in case of emergency, the grey stuff'll do too
LOL....if it works....WORK IT!
And here I was expecting to see a pic of GCD's hands taped together  Neat job with the tape. Hundred mile an hour tape sure is great.
I see he installed a gunner on the front end too. Keep them pesky bears away...
I would like to see some more use of TUCK tape, a little more colourful
Mythbusters did an episode on duck tape. Patched a hole in a boat, made a boat, picked up a car etc.
LOL.. I missed this part !!!   Wasn't me.. but I do know who it was and it is true.. was flown home this way. Not an issue.. that's what we call a "field repair" !
From need.. To Want.. To innovation! , oh wait.. thats 3M
West Jet
And it will probably keep flying that way until the insurance cheque comes in. Jim
The ship is based in Anchorage Alaska, here is a link to what happened.  Dan

I beleive steve smith from the red green show had a contest a few years back with duck tape.I think someone from the hammer won it.That plane would of topped it and won for sure.As for using it on the better half ITS NOT STRONG ENOUGH.esp when I say IM GOING FISHING.
Joke .....
I think it might have been Gerritt who once said, probably when referring to children, " Silence is golden, duct tape is silver." I agree.

I have seen that before but never posted it.  One day years back, probably 1984ish, I was down in Oshkosh Wisconsin for the annual Experimental Aircraft  Association show with my dad and a good friend of his. Tired of the tent breakfasts after 4 days, we took the shuttle to the terminal lounge. While eating breakfast, we noticed an F-14/16??(could have the model wrong now) parked outside. We finished breakfast and walked out to it to look it over while waiting for the shuttle to return. We gave it a good look over. I climbed up to the cockpit and there was a roll of duct tape on the dashboard. Shortly after that, the air force pilot came along, we introduced ourselves and said we hope you didn't mind us taking a closer look at your ride. He was all smiles and said, no problem, can I answer any questions? Immediately I asked him what the duct tape was for, and he replied, "everything, when I inspect my aircraft after landing, and find a small issue, I just tape it up, so that it does not become a larger issue until I can get it properly serviced". We laughed about that. Unfortunately no pictures, I left my SLR locked up in the truck by our tent    :wallbash:  We sure could not have done that in today's world now.
That's how we fix our F-150's and F-250's as well Tom. Duct tape.
3M used to sponsor a design school fashion show where the couture was all crafted from duct tape supplied by the company.
